page.title: 03...LANGUAGE
page.content: Most of the people in our area speak English. Our accent is {Brummie} and we use words which mean something different elsewhere eg. I had to {gew} (go) up the road for some shopping for {our}(my) mom. I said {ta-ra} (goodbye) to {ar kid}(my brother) and went. On my way I saw some {kids}(children) playing in the road. When I got to the shops I bought a pair of {pumps} (plimsoles). Next I went to the bakers for some {cobs} (bread buns}. Then I went to the {outdoor} (off-license) for some shandy On my way home I went {up the gulley} (through the alley). There I saw some {kids} (children) having a {knock} (fight).I told them to stop {scrapping} (fighting). One of them said {sharrit yow} (be quiet) or we'll {deck} (beat) you up. I{legged it}(ran)into {me} (my) house.{Me}(my){mom}(mum) said I've done you a {piece}(sandwich) {bab}(son).
